quotes: ITV News broadcast footage from the 2006 Conservative Party Conference in Bournemouth
In his column for The Guardian, comedy writer and broadcaster Charlie Brooker described the Conservative leader as 'a hollow Easter egg with no bag of sweets inside' in April 2007.
Quentin Davies, who defected from the Conservatives to Labour on 26 June 2007, branded him 'superficial, unreliable and [with] an apparent lack of any clear convictions'
Labour used the slogan Dave the Chameleon in their 2006 local elections party broadcast to portray Cameron as an ever-changing populist

During his 2005 Conservative leadership campaign, he addressed the question of drug consumption by remarking: 'I did lots of things before I came into politics which I shouldn't have done. We all did.'
Speaking at the Home Office on 13 May 2010 His Shadow Cabinet
